p: The different Coronaviridae genera are capable to induce infections in human and vertebrates: while γ-CoV and δ-CoV mainly affect birds, the α-CoV and β-CoV can affect human and various mammals by infecting respiratory, gastrointestinal, and central nervous system. SARS-CoV-2 belong to the β-CoV [ 1, 8]. The onset of clinical manifestations of SARS-CoV-2 seem to begin in less than a week and are commonly characterized by fever, cough, nasal congestion, asthenia, anosmia, and ageusia. The infection can progress in a severe lung disease with dyspnea, with the development of an atypical pneumonia that corresponds to bilateral ground-glass opacity detected in chest CT scans that might require the subject hospitalization [ 9].
